main_definition: Economies refer to the cost-saving measures, strategies, or systems aimed at reducing expenses while maintaining efficiency.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Cost savings in manufacturing and production processes
meanings_and_examples.example: Implementing economies of scale by producing goods on a larger scale to lower the cost per unit.
Automating certain tasks using artificial intelligence, leading to economic savings and increased productivity.
Choosing a smaller apartment or shared housing instead of renting an individual large space to save money.
Cutting back on certain social programs, but still maintaining essential services, as part of economic austerity measures.
